column1: - Some types of HPV can cause cervical cancer and other cancers.
- Low-risk types of HPV may cause genital warts in the vagina, cervix, and on the skin.
This examiner checks to see if the cells contain genetic material (called DNA) from types of HPV that cause cancer.
Avoid the following for 24 hours before the test: - Douching - Having intercourse - Taking a bath - Using tampons Empty your bladder just before the test.
High-risk types of HPV can lead to cervical cancer or anal cancer.
High-risk types of HPV may cause cervical cancer and cancer of the throat, tongue, anus, or vagina.
